taxReportPage.incomeFromTransfersInfo: Total gains from sale/trading of virtual digital assets
taxReportPage.businessIncomeInfo: Aggregate of incomes classified as Business/ Other Income, generally shall include interest, airdrops, mining income, etc.
taxReportPage.totalExpenseInfo: Aggregate expenses incurred during the period on all transactions undertaken
taxReportPage.netIncomeInfo: Aggregate income from gains on transfer and business/other income as reduced by expenses incurred
taxReportPage.fundsInfusedInfo: Aggregate value of money invested during the year
taxReportPage.fundsWithdrawnInfo: Aggregate amount of money withdrawn from all sources during the year
taxReportPage.reportBeingDownloaded: Your report is being downloaded. This might take a while.
taxReportPage.openingBalanceInfo: Fair Value of assets at the beginning of the financial year (1st April)
taxReportPage.closingBalanceInfo: Fair Value of assets at the end of the financial year (31st March)
taxReportPage.limitReached: You have exceeded the maximum transaction limit of your plan. Please subscribe to a plan to download your tax reports.
taxReportPage.disclaimer: IMPORTANT: All 'Transfer In' transactions have been considered to be in the nature of 'Internal Transfers' where any other tag (such as airdrop, interest etc.) has not been assigned to such 'Transfer In' transactions. On sale/ transfer of such digital assets, the fair market value (FMV) of the asset at the time of receipt into the respective wallet/exchange shall be considered as the cost basis for computation of gains on transfer. The said treatment shall stand modified once the user either provides the actual cost basis for 'internal transfer' or choose any other applicable tag for each such transaction.

sourcePage.fileImportSubTitile: Let's upload your files so we can automatically convert and import your data into the Hackoverflow tax engine.
sourcePage.followingFilesNotUploaded: The following file(s) could not be uploaded.
sourcePage.importFromGenericFile: How to import transactions from a generic file
sourcePage.dropFile: Drop or Browse your file
sourcePage.authConnectSubText:
Automate syncing transactions between Hackoverflow and your exchange!
By signing in you authorise Hackoverflow to securely integrate your transaction data and calculate taxes.
Once you link your account, all your transactions will seamlessly show up on Hackoverflow, and there is no need to sync your transactions manually.
sourcePage.fetchingDataToHackoverflow: We are fetching your data into your Hackoverflow account!
sourcePage.fetchingDataFromExchangeToHackoverflow: We are fetching your data from {{exchangeName}} to your Hackoverflow account!

settings.realizeGainsOnCrypto: Realize gains on crypto to crypto transactions
settings.realizeGainsOnCryptoTooltip: If this is enabled, gains on crypto to crypto transactions will be considered as taxable
settings.treatAirdropsAsIncomeTooltip: If this is enabled, tax will be calculated on the FMV of the asset received as airdrop on the date of such receipt. Such FMV shall be the cost base at the time of sale at a later point of time. If disabled, the cost for this asset will be taken as 'Zero' while calculating tax on its later sale and no tax incidence at the time of receiving airdrop.
settings.treatForksAsIncomeTooltip: If this is enabled, tax will be calculated on the FMV of the asset received from fork on the date of such receipt. Such FMV shall be the cost base at the time of sale at a later point of time. If disabled, the cost for this asset will be taken as 'Zero' while calculating tax on its later sale and no tax incidence at the time of receiving assets from fork.
settings.treatMiningAsIncomeTooltip: If this is enabled, tax will be calculated on the FMV of the asset received from mining on the date of such receipt. Such FMV shall be the cost base at the time of sale at a later point of time. If disabled, the cost for this asset will be taken as 'Zero' while calculating tax on its later sale and no tax incidence at the time of receiving assets from mining.
settings.treatStakingRewardsAsIncomeTooltip: If this is enabled, tax will be calculated on the FMV of the asset received as reward on the date of such receipt. Such FMV shall be the cost base at the time of sale at a later point of time. If disabled, the cost for this asset will be taken as 'Zero' while calculating tax on its later sale and no tax incidence at the time of receiving rewards.

welcomePage.infoText: Hello {{firstName}}! We can't wait to help you compute your crypto taxes. Let's import some data and get started.
